body_html:
I had a similar error even though my images appear to be valid JPEG images. Like the previous error my Tensorflow error was:
InvalidArgumentError (see above for traceback): Invalid JPEG data, size 4096
[[Node: DecodeJpeg = DecodeJpegacceptable_fraction=1, channels=3, dct_method="", fancy_upscaling=true, ratio=1, try_recover_truncated=false, _device="/job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/cpu:0"]]
I checked the JPEG files with
file *.jpg
They are all: JPEG image data, JFIF standard 1.01
With vi -b 01-007.jpg The files start:
^@^PJFIF^@^A^A^A^A,
Which seems to match "Valid JFIF files begin with FF D8 FF E0 ?? ?? 'J' 'F' 'I' 'F' 00." from Wikipedia: http://fileformats.archiveteam.org/wiki/JFIF
All the images decode without error using a Tensorflow call
with tf.Graph().as_default():
image_contents = tf.read_file(filePath)
image = tf.image.decode_jpeg(image_contents, channels=channels)
init_op = tf.tables_initializer()
with tf.Session() as sess:
sess.run(init_op)
decoded = sess.run(image)
So I don't know what causing the error.
body_text:
I had a similar error even though my images appear to be valid JPEG images. Like the previous error my Tensorflow error was:
InvalidArgumentError (see above for traceback): Invalid JPEG data, size 4096
[[Node: DecodeJpeg = DecodeJpegacceptable_fraction=1, channels=3, dct_method="", fancy_upscaling=true, ratio=1, try_recover_truncated=false, _device="/job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/cpu:0"]]
I checked the JPEG files with
file *.jpg
They are all: JPEG image data, JFIF standard 1.01
With vi -b 01-007.jpg   The files start:
^@^PJFIF^@^A^A^A^A,
Which seems to match "Valid JFIF files begin with FF D8 FF E0 ?? ?? 'J' 'F' 'I' 'F' 00." from Wikipedia: http://fileformats.archiveteam.org/wiki/JFIF
All the images decode without error using a Tensorflow call
with tf.Graph().as_default():
image_contents = tf.read_file(filePath)
image = tf.image.decode_jpeg(image_contents, channels=channels)
init_op = tf.tables_initializer()
with tf.Session() as sess:
sess.run(init_op)
decoded = sess.run(image)
So I don't know what causing the error.
body:
I had a similar error even though my images appear to be valid JPEG images. Like the previous error my Tensorflow error was:
InvalidArgumentError (see above for traceback): Invalid JPEG data, size 4096
         [[Node: DecodeJpeg = DecodeJpeg[acceptable_fraction=1, channels=3, dct_method="", fancy_upscaling=true, ratio=1, try_recover_truncated=false, _device="/job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/cpu:0"](_recv_DecodeJpeg/contents_0)]]
I checked the JPEG files with 
file *.jpg
They are all: JPEG image data, JFIF standard 1.01
With vi -b 01-007.jpg   The files start: 
<ff><d8><ff><e0>^@^PJFIF^@^A^A^A^A,
Which seems to match "Valid JFIF files begin with FF D8 FF E0 ?? ?? 'J' 'F' 'I' 'F' 00." from Wikipedia: http://fileformats.archiveteam.org/wiki/JFIF 
All the images decode without error using a Tensorflow call
with tf.Graph().as_default():
        image_contents = tf.read_file(filePath)
        image = tf.image.decode_jpeg(image_contents, channels=channels)
        init_op = tf.tables_initializer()
        with tf.Session() as sess:
            sess.run(init_op)
            decoded = sess.run(image)
So I don't know what causing the error.
